CreateAllocationTag.document: This API is used to batch set cost allocation tags.
CreateAllocationTag.name: Batch sets cost allocation tags

DeleteAllocationTag.document: u200cThis API is used to batch cancel cost allocation tags.
DeleteAllocationTag.name: Batch cancels cost allocation tags

DescribeAccountBalance.document: This API is used to check the Tencent Cloud account balance.
DescribeAccountBalance.name: Checks account balance

DescribeBillDetail.document:
u200cThis API is used to get bill details.
Note:
1. The API request may fail due to network instability or other exceptions. In this case, we recommend you manually retry the request when the API request fails.
2.If the volume of your bill data is high (for example, if over 200 thousand bill entries are generated for a month), bill data query via APIs may be slow. We recommend you enable bill storage so that you can obtain bill files from COS buckets for analysis. For details, see [Saving Bills to COS](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/555/61275?from_cn_redirect=1).
DescribeBillDetail.name: Gets bill details

DescribeBillDetailForOrganization.document:
This API is used to get pay-on-behalf bills of the admin account (bill details).
Note: The API request may fail due to network instability or other exceptions. In this case, we recommend you manually retry the request when the API request fails.
DescribeBillDetailForOrganization.name: Gets pay-on-behalf bills of the admin account (bill details)

DescribeBillDownloadUrl.document: This API is used to get bill download URLs for L0, L1, L2, and L3 bills and bill packs.
DescribeBillDownloadUrl.name: Gets bill download URLs

DescribeBillResourceSummary.document: This API is used to get the bill summarized by instance.
DescribeBillResourceSummary.name: Gets the bill summarized by instance

DescribeBillResourceSummaryForOrganizati.document: This API is used to get pay-on-behalf bills of the admin account (bills by instance).
DescribeBillResourceSummaryForOrganizati.name: Gets pay-on-behalf bills of the admin account (bills by instance)

DescribeBillSummary.document: This API is used to get bill details by product, project, region, billing mode, and tag by passing in parameters.
DescribeBillSummary.name: Gets bills summarized by multiple dimensions

DescribeBillSummaryByPayMode.document: This API is used to get the bill summarized by billing mode.
DescribeBillSummaryByPayMode.name: Gets the bill summarized by billing mode

DescribeBillSummaryByProduct.document: Gets the bill summarized according to product
DescribeBillSummaryByProduct.name: Gets the bill summarized according to product

DescribeBillSummaryByProject.document: Gets the bill summarized according to project
DescribeBillSummaryByProject.name: Gets the bill summarized according to project

DescribeBillSummaryByRegion.document: Gets the bill summarized according to region
DescribeBillSummaryByRegion.name: Gets the bill summarized according to region

DescribeBillSummaryByTag.document: This API is used to get the cost distribution over different tags.
DescribeBillSummaryByTag.name: Gets cost distribution over different tags

DescribeBillSummaryForOrganization.document: This API is used to get bills summarized by product, project, region, billing mode, and tag by passing in parameters.
DescribeBillSummaryForOrganization.name: Gets pay-on-behalf bills of the admin account (bills by multiple dimensions)

DescribeDosageCosDetailByDate.document: This API is used to query COS usage details.
DescribeDosageCosDetailByDate.name: Queries COS usage details

DescribeTagList.document: This API is used to get cost allocation tags.
DescribeTagList.name: Gets cost allocation tags

DescribeVoucherInfo.document: This API is used to query vouchers.
DescribeVoucherInfo.name: Queries vouchers

DescribeVoucherUsageDetails.document: This API is used to query voucher usage details.
DescribeVoucherUsageDetails.name: Queries voucher usage details

ActionSummaryOverviewItem.document: Detailed summary of costs by transaction type

members.document: Transaction type code
members.name: ActionType

members.document: Transaction type, which can be monthly subscription purchase, monthly subscription renewal, or pay-as-you-go deduction.
members.name: ActionTypeName

members.document: Cost ratio, to two decimal points
members.name: RealTotalCostRatio

members.document: Total amount after discount
members.name: RealTotalCost

members.document: Cash credit: The amount paid from the user’s cash account
members.name: CashPayAmount

members.document: Free credit: The amount paid with the user’s free credit
members.name: IncentivePayAmount

members.document: Voucher payment: The voucher deduction amount
members.name: VoucherPayAmount

members.document: Commission credit: The amount paid with the user’s commission credit. Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: TransferPayAmount

members.document: Billing month, e.g. `2019-08`
members.name: BillMonth

members.document: The original cost in USD. This parameter has become valid since v3.0 bills took effect in May 2021, and before that `-` was returned for this parameter. If a customer uses a contract price different from the published price, `-` will also be returned for this parameter.
members.name: TotalCost

members.document: Valid values: `all products` or names of the applicable products (string). Multiple names are separated by commas.
members.name: GoodsName

members.document: Valid values: `postPay`: pay-as-you-go; `prePay`: prepaid; `riPay`: reserved instance; empty or `*`: all. If `GoodsName` contains multiple product names and `PayMode` is `*`, it indicates that the voucher can be used in all billing modes for each of the products.
members.name: PayMode

members.document: Product name: The name of a Tencent Cloud product purchased by the user, such as CVM.
members.name: BusinessCodeName

members.document: Subproduct name: The subcategory of a Tencent Cloud product purchased by the user, such as CVM – Standard S1.
members.name: ProductCodeName

members.document: Billing mode, which can be monthly subscription or pay-as-you-go.
members.name: PayModeName

members.document: Project name: The project to which a resource belongs, which is user-designated. If a resource has not been assigned to a project, it will automatically belong to the default project.
members.name: ProjectName

members.document: Region: The region to which a resource belongs, such as South China (Guangzhou).
members.name: RegionName

members.document: Availability zone: availability zone of a resource, e.g. Guangzhou Zone 3
members.name: ZoneName

members.document: Instance ID: The object ID of a billed resource, such as a CVM instance ID. This object ID may vary due to various forms and contents of resources in different products.
members.name: ResourceId

members.document: Instance name: The resource name set by the user in the console. If it is not set, it will be empty by default.
members.name: ResourceName

members.document: Transaction type, which can be monthly subscription purchase, monthly subscription renewal, or pay-as-you-go deduction.
members.name: ActionTypeName

members.document: Order ID: The order number for a monthly subscription purchase
members.name: OrderId

members.document: Transaction ID: The bill number for a deducted payment
members.name: BillId

members.document: Transaction time: The time at which a payment was deducted
members.name: PayTime

members.document: Usage start time: The time at which product or service usage starts
members.name: FeeBeginTime

members.document: Usage end time: The time at which product or service usage ends
members.name: FeeEndTime

members.document: Component list
members.name: ComponentSet

members.document: Payer account ID: The account ID of the payer, which is the unique identifier of a Tencent Cloud user.
members.name: PayerUin

members.document: Owner account ID: The account ID of the actual resource user
members.name: OwnerUin

members.document: Operator account ID: The account or role ID of the operator who purchases or activates a resource
members.name: OperateUin

members.document: Tag information. Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Tags

members.document: Product code. Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: BusinessCode

members.document: Subproduct code. Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: ProductCode

members.document: Transaction type code. Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: ActionType

members.document: Region ID. Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: RegionId

members.document: Project ID
members.name: ProjectId

members.document:
Price attribute: A set of attributes which will determine the price of a component, apart from unit price and usage duration.
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.example: ["操作系统"："linux"，"连续使用时长T"："第三阶梯"，"平台"："云平"]
members.name: PriceInfo

members.document:
Associated transaction document ID: The ID of the document associated with a transaction, such as a write-off order, the original order showing a deduction error during first settlement, a restructured order, or the original purchase order corresponding to a refund order.
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: AssociatedOrder

members.document:
Calculation formula: The detailed calculation formula for a specific transaction type, such as refund or configuration change.
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Formula

members.document:
Billing rules: Official website links for detailed billing rules of each product.
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: FormulaUrl

BillDetailAssociatedOrder.document: Information of the document associated with bill details

members.document:
Purchase order.
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: PrepayPurchase

members.document:
Renewal order.
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: PrepayRenew

members.document:
Upgrade order.
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: PrepayModifyUp

members.document:
Write-off order.
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: ReverseOrder

members.document:
The order after discount.
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: NewOrder

members.document:
The original order before discount.
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Original

BillDetailComponent.document: Information about components charged in the bill

members.document: Component type: The component type of a product or service purchased, such as CVM instance components including CPU and memory.
members.name: ComponentCodeName

members.document: Component name: The specific component of a product or service purchased
members.name: ItemCodeName

members.document: Component list price: The listed unit price of a component. If a customer has applied for a fixed preferential price or contract price, this parameter will not be displayed by default.
members.name: SinglePrice

members.document: Specified price of a component. This parameter has been deprecated.
members.name: SpecifiedPrice

members.document: Component price measurement unit: The unit of measurement for a component price, which is composed of USD, usage unit, and duration unit.
members.name: PriceUnit

members.document: Component usage: The actually settled usage of a component, which is "Raw usage - Deducted usage (including packages)".
members.name: UsedAmount

members.document: Component usage unit: The unit of measurement for component usage
members.name: UsedAmountUnit

members.document: Raw usage/duration: The raw usage/duration of a component before deduction. Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: RealTotalMeasure

members.document: Deducted usage/duration (including packages): The usage/duration deducted with a package. Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: DeductedMeasure

members.document: Usage duration: The resource usage duration
members.name: TimeSpan

members.document: Duration unit: The unit of measurement for usage duration
members.name: TimeUnitName

members.document: Original cost: The original cost of a resource, which is "List price x Usage x Usage duration". If a customer has applied for a fixed preferential price or contract price or is in a refund scenario, this parameter will not be displayed by default.
members.name: Cost

members.document: Discount multiplier: The discount multiplier applied to the cost of the resource. If a customer has applied for a fixed preferential price or contract price or is in a refund scenario, this parameter will not be displayed by default.
members.name: Discount

members.document: Offer type
members.name: ReduceType

members.document: Total amount after discount: Total amount after discount = (Original cost - RI deduction (cost) - SP deduction (cost)) x Discount multiplier
members.name: RealCost

members.document: Voucher payment: The voucher deduction amount
members.name: VoucherPayAmount

members.document: Cash credit: The amount paid from the user’s cash account
members.name: CashPayAmount

members.document: Free credit: The amount paid with the user’s free credit
members.name: IncentivePayAmount

members.document: Commission credit: The amount paid with the user’s commission credit. Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: TransferPayAmount

members.document: Component type code. Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: ItemCode

members.document: Component name code. Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: ComponentCode

members.document: Component contracted price: The contracted unit price of a component, which is "List price x Discount". Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: ContractPrice

members.document: Instance type: The instance type of a product or service purchased, which can be resource package, RI, SP, or spot instance. Other instance types are not displayed by default. Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: InstanceType

members.document: RI deduction (duration): The usage duration deducted by RI. Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: RiTimeSpan

members.document: RI deduction (cost): The amount deducted from the original cost by RI. Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: OriginalCostWithRI

members.document: Savings plan deduction rate: The discount multiplier that applies to the component based on the remaining commitment of the savings plan. Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: SPDeductionRate

members.document: Cost deduction by SP. This parameter has been deprecated. Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: SPDeduction

members.document: SP deduction (cost): SP deduction (cost) = Cost deduction by SP / SP deduction rate. Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: OriginalCostWithSP

members.document: Blended discount multiplier: The final discount multiplier that is applied after combining multiple discount types, which is "Total amount after discount / Original cost". Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: BlendedDiscount

members.document:
Configuration description: The specification configuration of an instance.
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: ComponentConfig

members.document:
Configuration description name
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Name

members.document:
Configuration description value
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Value

members.document: Product name: The name of a Tencent Cloud product purchased by the user, such as CVM.

members.example: 实时音视频-音视频通话
members.name: ProductCodeName

members.document: Billing mode: The billing mode, which can be monthly subscription or pay-as-you-go.
members.name: PayModeName

members.document: Project Name: The project to which a resource belongs, which is user-designated. If a resource has not been assigned to a project, it will automatically belong to the default project.
members.name: ProjectName

members.document: Region: The region of a resource, e.g. South China (Guangzhou).
members.name: RegionName

members.document: Availability zone: The availability zone of a resource, e.g. Guangzhou Zone 3.
members.name: ZoneName

members.document: Instance ID: The object ID of a billed resource, such as a CVM instance ID. This object ID may vary due to various forms and contents of resources in different products.
members.name: ResourceId

members.document: Instance name: The resource name set by the user in the console. If it is not set, it will be empty by default.
members.name: ResourceName

members.document: Transaction type, which can be monthly subscription purchase, monthly subscription renewal, pay-as-you-go deduction, etc.
members.name: ActionTypeName

members.document: Order ID: The ID of a monthly subscription order.
members.name: OrderId

members.document: Deduction time: The settlement cost deduction time.
members.name: PayTime

members.document: Usage start time: The time at which product or service usage starts.
members.name: FeeBeginTime

members.document: Usage end time: The time at which product or service usage ends.
members.name: FeeEndTime

members.document: Configuration description: The billable item names and usage of a resource, which are displayed on the resource bill only.
members.example: 音视频通话-自定义套餐包: 1000分钟;
members.name: ConfigDesc

members.document: Extended Field 1: The extended attribute information of a product, which is displayed on the resource bill only.
members.name: ExtendField1

members.document: Extended field 2: The extended attribute information of a product, which is displayed on the resource bill only.
members.name: ExtendField2

members.document: Original cost. The original cost of a component = Component price x Usage x Usage duration. If a customer has applied for a fixed preferential price or contract price or if a customer is in a refund scenario, this parameter will not be displayed by default.
members.name: TotalCost

members.document: Discount multiplier: The discount multiplier that applies to the component. If a customer has applied for a fixed preferential price or contract price or if a customer is in a refund scenario, this parameter will not be displayed by default.
members.name: Discount

members.document: Offer type.
members.name: ReduceType

members.document: Total amount after discount.
members.name: RealTotalCost

members.document: Voucher payment: The voucher deduction amount.
members.name: VoucherPayAmount

members.document: Cash credit payment: The amount paid through the user's cash account.
members.name: CashPayAmount

members.document: Free credit payment: The amount paid with the user's free credit.
members.name: IncentivePayAmount

members.document:
Commission credit payment: The amount paid with the user's commission credit.
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: TransferPayAmount

members.document: Extended field 3: The extended attribute information of a product, which is displayed on the resource bill only.
members.name: ExtendField3

members.document: Extended field 4: The extended attribute information of a product, which is displayed on the resource bill only.
members.name: ExtendField4

members.document: Extended field 5: The extended attribute information of a product, which is displayed on the resource bill only.
members.name: ExtendField5

members.document:
Tag information.
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Tags

members.document: Owner account ID: The account ID of the actual resource user.
members.name: OwnerUin

members.document: Operator account ID: The account or role ID of the operator who purchases or activates a resource.
members.name: OperateUin

members.document: Product code.
members.name: BusinessCode

members.document: Subproduct code.
members.name: ProductCode

members.document: Region ID.
members.name: RegionId

members.document: Instance type: The instance type of a product or service purchased, which can be resource package, RI, SP, or spot instance. Other instance types are not displayed by default.
members.name: InstanceType

members.document: RI deduction (cost): The amount deducted from the original cost by RI.
members.name: OriginalCostWithRI

members.document: Savings plan deduction (disused).
members.name: SPDeduction

members.document: SP deduction (cost): The amount of cost deducted by a savings plan based on the component's original cost. SP deduction (cost) = Cost deduction by SP / SP deduction rate
members.name: OriginalCostWithSP

members.document: Available account balance in cents, which takes the same calculation rules as `Balance`, `CreditBalance`, and `RealCreditBalance`.
members.name: RealBalance

members.document: Cash account balance in cents. Currently, this field is not applied.
members.name: CashAccountBalance

members.document: Income account balance in cents. Currently, this field is not applied.
members.name: IncomeIntoAccountBalance

members.document: Present account balance in cents. Currently, this field is not applied.
members.name: PresentAccountBalance

members.document: Frozen amount in cents.
members.name: FreezeAmount

members.document: Overdue amount in cents, which is when the available credit balance is negative.
members.name: OweAmount

members.document: Whether overdue payments are allowed. Currently, this field is not applied.
members.name: IsAllowArrears

members.document: Whether you have a credit limit. Currently, this field is not applied.
members.name: IsCreditLimited

members.document: Credit limit in cents. Credit limit－available credit balance = consumption amount
members.name: CreditAmount

members.document: Available credit balance in cents, which takes the same calculation rules as `Balance`, `RealBalance`, and `RealCreditBalance`.
members.name: CreditBalance

members.document: Available account balance in cents, which takes the same calculation rules as `Balance`, `RealBalance`, and `CreditBalance`.
members.name: RealCreditBalance

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Pagination offset. If `Offset` is `0`, it indicates the first page. When `Limit` is `100`, if `Offset` is `100`, it indicates the second page; if `Offset` is `200`, it indicates the third page, and so on.
members.name: Offset

members.document: The number of entries returned at a time. The maximum value is `100`.
members.name: Limit

members.document: Cycle type, which can be `byUsedTime` (by billing cycle) or `byPayTime` (by deduction time). This value must be the same as the billing period type in Billing Center for that particular month. You can check your billing cycle at the top of the [Bill Overview](https://console.cloud.tencent.com/expense/bill/overview) page.
members.name: PeriodType

members.document: Bill month in the format of "yyyy-mm". You only have to enter either `Month` or `BeginTime` and `EndTime`. When you enter values for `BeginTime` and `EndTime`, `Month` becomes invalid. This value must be no earlier than the month when Bill 2.0 is activated; last 18 months data is available.
members.name: Month

members.document: Start time of the cycle in the format of "yyyy-mm-dd hh:ii:ss". You only have to enter either `Month` or `BeginTime` and `EndTime`. When you enter values for `BeginTime` and `EndTime`, `Month` becomes invalid. `BeginTime` and `EndTime` must be passed together, and their values must be of the same month. Query period must start and end on the same month, andthe query result returned will be of the entire month. This value must be no earlier than the month when Bill 2.0 is activated; last 18 months data is available.
members.name: BeginTime

members.document: End time of the cycle in the format of "yyyy-mm-dd hh:ii:ss". You only have to enter either `Month` or `BeginTime` and `EndTime`. When you enter values for `BeginTime` and `EndTime`, `Month` becomes invalid. `BeginTime` and `EndTime` must be passed together, and their values must be of the same month. Query period must start and end on the same month, andthe query result returned will be of the entire month. This value must be no earlier than the month when Bill 2.0 is activated; last 18 months data is available.
members.name: EndTime

members.document:
Indicates whether the total number of records is required, used for pagination.
Valid values: `1` (required), `0` (not required).
members.name: NeedRecordNum

members.document: Billing mode, which can be `prePay` (monthly subscription) or `postPay` (pay-as-you-go).
members.name: PayMode

members.document: ID of the instance to be queried.
members.name: ResourceId

members.document:
Transaction type. This parameter needs to be input using the `ActionTypeName` value. Valid values:
Monthly subscription purchase

Monthly subscription refund

Prepaid

RI refund

Monthly subscription to pay-as-you-go 
Minimum spend deduction 
Hourly savings plan fee

members.name: ProjectId

members.document: Product code. Note: To query the product codes used in the current month, call DescribeBillSummaryByProduct.
members.name: BusinessCode

members.document: Context information returned by the last response. You can view multiple pages when querying for data after May 2023 to speed up the query. We recommend you use this query method if your data volume is above 100 thousand entries, which can improve query speed by 2-10 times.
members.name: Context

members.document: Details list.
members.name: DetailSet

members.document:
Total number of records, which is cached every 24 hours and may be less than the actual total number of records.
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Total

members.document:
Context information of the current request, which can be used in the parameters of the next request to speed up the query.
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Context

members.name: RequestId

members.document: Offset
members.name: Offset

members.document: Quantity, maximum is 100
members.name: Limit

members.document: The period type. byUsedTime: By usage period; byPayTime: By payment period. Must be the same as the period of the current monthly bill of the Billing Center. You can check your bill statistics period type at the top of the [Bill Overview](https://console.cloud.tencent.com/expense/bill/overview) page.
members.name: PeriodType

members.document: Month; format: yyyy-mm. You only have to enter either Month or BeginTime and EndTime. When you enter values for BeginTime and EndTime, Month becomes invalid. This value must be no earlier than the month when Bill 2.0 is activated; last 24 months data are available.
members.name: Month

members.document:
The start time of the query range, which should be in the format Y-m-d H:i:s . The query range must be in the last 18 months and cannot be earlier than May 2018 (when Bill 2.0 was introduced). The start time and end time must be in the same month.

Example: tccli billing DescribeBillDetail --cli-unfold-argument --Offset 1 --Limit 100 --BeginTime '2023-04-01 12:05:15' --EndTime '2023-04-18 12:00:10' --ProjectId 1000000731  --version "2018-07-09"

Alternatively, you can use Month to query the billing details of a month.
Example:
ccli billing DescribeBillDetail --cli-unfold-argument --Offset 1 --Limit 100 --Month 2023-04  --version "2018-07-09" --ResourceId "disk-oj9okstm"
members.name: BeginTime

members.document:
The end time of the query range, which should be in the format `Y-m-d H:i:s `. The query range must be in the last 18 months and cannot be earlier than May 2018 (when Bill 2.0 was introduced). The start time and end time must be in the same month.

Example: tccli billing DescribeBillDetail --cli-unfold-argument --Offset 1 --Limit 100 --BeginTime '2023-04-01 12:05:15' --EndTime '2023-04-18 12:00:10' --ProjectId 1000000731  --version "2018-07-09"

Alternatively, you can use `Month` to query the billing details of a month. 
Example:
ccli billing DescribeBillDetail --cli-unfold-argument --Offset 1 --Limit 100 --Month 2023-04  --version "2018-07-09" --ResourceId "disk-oj9okstm"
members.name: EndTime

members.document:
Bill type. Valid values:
`billOverview` (L0: PDF bills)

`billResource` (L2: Bill by instance)	
`billDetail` (L3: Bill details)	
`billPack` (Bill packs)
members.name: FileType

members.document:
Bill month.
The earliest month that can be queried is January 2021.
L0 bills and bill packs cannot be downloaded for the current month. Please download the current month's bills after it is generated at 19:00 on the 1st day of the next month.
members.name: Month

members.name: TimeFrom

members.document: The end date of the voucher issuance, such as `2021-01-01`.
members.name: TimeTo

members.document: The field used to sort the records. Valid values: BeginTime, EndTime, CreateTime.
members.name: SortField

members.document: Whether to sort the records in ascending or descending order. Valid values: desc, asc.
members.name: SortOrder

members.document: The payment mode. Valid values: `postPay`: pay-as-you-go; `prePay`: prepaid; `riPay`: reserved instance; empty or `*`: all. If this parameter is empty or `*`, `productCode` and `subProductCode` must also be empty.
members.name: PayMode

members.document: If `PayMode` is `postPay`, this parameter may be `spotpay` (spot instance) or `settle account` (regular pay-as-you-go). If `PayMode` is `prePay`, this parameter may be `purchase`, `renew`, or `modify` (downgrade/upgrade). If `PayMode` is `riPay`, this parameter may be `oneOffFee` (prepayment of reserved instance) or `hourlyFee` (hourly billing of reserved instance). `*` means to query vouchers that support all billing scenarios.
members.name: PayScene

members.document: The operator. The default is the UIN of the current user.

The voucher information.

members.document: The page number the records start from. The default is 1.
members.name: Offset

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Product name: The name of a Tencent Cloud product purchased by the user, such as CVM.
members.name: BusinessCodeName

members.document: Subproduct name: The subcategory of a Tencent Cloud product purchased by the user, such as CVM - Standard S1.
members.name: ProductCodeName

members.document: Billing mode: The billing mode, which can be monthly subscription or pay-as-you-go.
members.name: PayModeName

members.document: Project Name: The project to which a resource belongs, which is user-designated. If a resource has not been assigned to a project, it will automatically belong to the default project.
members.name: ProjectName

members.document: Region: The region of a resource, e.g. South China (Guangzhou).
members.name: RegionName

members.document: Availability zone: availability zone of a resource, e.g. Guangzhou Zone 3.
members.name: ZoneName

members.document: Instance ID: The object ID of a billed resource, such as a CVM instance ID. This object ID may vary due to various forms and contents of resources in different products.
members.name: ResourceId

members.document: Instance name: The resource name set by the user in the console. If it is not set, it will be empty by default.
members.name: ResourceName

members.document: Transaction type, which can be monthly subscription purchase, monthly subscription renewal, pay-as-you-go deduction, etc.
members.name: ActionTypeName

members.document: Order ID: The ID of a monthly subscription order.
members.name: OrderId

members.document: Transaction ID: The ID of a settlement bill.
members.name: BillId

members.document: Deduction time: The settlement cost deduction time.
members.name: PayTime

members.document: Usage start time: The time at which product or service usage starts.
members.name: FeeBeginTime

members.document: Usage end time: The time at which product or service usage ends.
members.name: FeeEndTime

members.document: List of components.
members.name: ComponentSet

members.document: Owner account ID: The account ID of the actual resource user.
members.name: OwnerUin

members.document: Operator account ID: The account or role ID of the operator who purchases or activates a resource.
members.name: OperateUin

Tag information.

Region ID.

members.document: Project ID.
members.name: ProjectId

members.document:
Price attribute: A set of attributes which will determine the price of a component, apart from unit price and usage duration.
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.example: ["操作系统"："linux"，"连续使用时长T"："第三阶梯"，"平台"："云平"]
members.name: PriceInfo

members.document:
Associated transaction document ID: The ID of the document associated with a transaction, such as a write-off order, the original order showing a deduction error during first settlement, a restructured order, or the original purchase order corresponding to a refund order.
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: AssociatedOrder

members.document:
Calculation formula: The detailed calculation formula for a specific transaction type, such as refund or configuration change.
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Formula

members.document:
Billing rules: Official website links for detailed billing rules of each product.
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: FormulaUrl

members.document: The voucher ID.
members.name: VoucherId

members.document: `postPay`: pay-as-you-go; `prePay`: prepaid; `riPay`: reserved instance; empty or `*`: all.
members.name: PayMode

members.document: If `PayMode` is `postPay`, this parameter may be `spotpay` (spot instance) or `settle account` (regular pay-as-you-go). If `PayMode` is `prePay`, this parameter may be `purchase`, `renew`, or `modify` (downgrade/upgrade). If `PayMode` is `riPay`, this parameter may be `oneOffFee` (prepayment of reserved instance) or `hourlyFee` (hourly billing of reserved instance). `*` means to query vouchers that support all billing scenarios.
members.name: PayScene
